text: problem if you have so many small utils depending on dataframes and each will have to be updated….

text: What is breaking? Are there PRs we can help with?

elements.text: What is breaking? Are there PRs we can help with?

text: I have just checked and e.g. <https://github.com/JuliaML/MLDataUtils.jl> has explicit constraints on DataFrames.jl versions allowed so nothing should be breaking there.

elements.text: I have just checked and e.g.
has explicit constraints on DataFrames.jl versions allowed so nothing should be breaking there.

text: Also there is e.g. <https://github.com/JuliaML/MLDataUtils.jl/issues/46> open and this is essentially what should be done in that package I think.

elements.text: open and this is essentially what should be done in that package I think.

text: yeah the internals seem to never use anything beyond getindex and setindex

elements.text: yeah the internals seem to never use anything beyond getindex and setindex

text: Also - probably ML packages should depend on Tables.jl rather than DataFrames

elements.text: Also - probably ML packages should depend on Tables.jl rather than DataFrames

text: yeah, this should be fixed because they form the base part of ML packages. my base package is using latest DataFrames, but my other package which install MLDataUtils will load the old dataframes. the test cases errors out because the base package expects DataFrames(::Matrix,:Symbol) while the old one does not recognize Symbol.

elements.text: yeah, this should be fixed because they form the base part of ML packages. my base package is using latest DataFrames, but my other package which install MLDataUtils will load the old dataframes. the test cases errors out because the base package expects DataFrames(::Matrix,:Symbol) while the old one does not recognize Symbol.
